intro: Gerbera curvisquama, commonly known as the spiral gerbera, is a striking member of the Asteraceae family native to South Africa. It is characterized by its vibrant, daisy-like flowers with showy, petal-like rays and a central disk of tubular florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in shades of red, orange, and yellow, often with a distinctive spiral pattern in the center. Gerbera curvisquama thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
